subject: Business
title: The Decoy Effect in Pricing
description: A 60-second lesson on The Decoy Effect in Pricing.

hook.text: Small popcorn: $3. Large: $7. Nobody buys large. Add medium at $6.50 and suddenly large looks like a steal.

buildup.text: The decoy effect adds a third option that makes one of the originals look far more attractive.

discovery.text: The decoy is never meant to be chosen. Its only purpose is to push customers toward the target option.

twist.text: The Economist tested this: web-only $59, print-only $125, web+print $125.

climax.text: SaaS companies use three-tier pricing for this exact reason. The middle tier is often the decoy.

punchline.text: The option you ignore is the one doing all the selling.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the decoy option in pricing?
options: To make the target option look more attractive by comparison
To offer customers a budget choice
To confuse competitors about the pricing strategy
